conversations.content: This is the Windwyrm's castle, then? I like it. Smells like a challenge.
...Hmm? Do you have business here at the Halidom?
Ah. You live here?
I do. My name is Cleo. And you are?
Vanessa. A warrior out training afield.
I heard talk of this place and came to sign up.
I'm not one to brag, but I'm undefeated in combat.
I'm sure I'll be a useful addition.
Not a single loss? That IS impressive.
Not one—and I'm DYING to finally see what it's like.
Yes, I would imagine you... Wait, you're eager to see what it feels like to LOSE?
Ha ha ha! Not something you hear every day, right? And yet, it's true.
＂To know defeat is to tread the first step to true strength.＂ That's something I was taught a long time ago.
I've been traveling around looking for someone to beat me ever since.
Goodness... I see. I suppose there is a certain logic to that?
Right? I just need one little loss, then I can start REALLY making strides!
Ahh, I can't WAIT to lose!
...No, definitely still strange.
You can't grow without experience! And new experiences mean the chance for new growth.
Loss is just another new experience. Or new to me, at least. Is that so strange?
I suppose not, when you explain it that way.
But are you certain a person capable of defeating you even exists?
I've got a lead on one.
I saw her years back, in a little harbor town. You never saw such a knight.
A knight?
Until she took lance in hand, at least. Then she was like a hurricane.
She'll beat me. I'm counting on it.
A female knight and master of the lance... Elisanne?
Hm? You say something?
No. Nothing important.
You're a welcome guest in the Halidom, but I would ask you not to go picking fights at random.
Hah! I'll mind my manners. And thanks. Now it's time to track down the strongest one here...
Perhaps I should tell Elisanne.
Graooowr!
Rgh, this fiend is hardy...
But what of THIS?! HAAAH!
That lance handling... It has to be!
It was YOU, Elisanne! Finally, my search is over!
I'm afraid I don't know what—
No more talk! We fight, here and now! FACE ME!
What?! What cause have we to fight?
I've spent years searching for the lance- wielding knight I saw that day!
And that knight is me? You're cer—
Absolutely certain.
That form just now is exactly the same as the one etched in my memory all this time.
You stood resolute on the wharf against an entire ship of pirates, sending one after the next into the sea.
You were unstoppable. A force of nature.
I knew in that moment you would be the one to defeat me.
Now, face me! Let me taste defeat!
Start me down the path to greater strength!
I certainly understand the drive to improve, but I still don't see why we must fight.
If you wished to train together, I would gladly join you. We could even spar, if that is more to your—
Spar?! Out of the question.
I'm talking about a proper duel! We fight for our lives and don't stop till one of us can fight no more!
Then I must decline.
I see no merit to be had in trading injuries among allies.
Wait, Elisanne! No... Not after I've finally found you.
I'm not backing down!
Graooooowr!
Elisanne! Fight me!
What?! Surely now is not the time!
Graaaarrgghh!
Elisanne! Urgent news!
I've a pressing message from Euden.
What? What did he say?
Listen carefully... ＂You have to fight Vanessa!＂
He said no such thing!
Honestly, Vanessa is impossible...
It's been a long day. I'm eager to get in—
AAAAH! VANESSA! Why are you hiding in my bed?!
...Fwite me?
Saying it in a cute voice doesn't change my answer!
*pant* Just how long does she intend to hound me...?
Seems like you and Vanessa are fast friends lately, Elly.
What?! Surely you jest!
What part of this waking nightmare looks like friendship to you?!
Er...all of it?
Ooh! Found you, Elly!
Eep!
(She shouldn't be able to find me as long as I stay hidden in here...)
Ellyyy! Oh, Elisaaaaanne! Come out, come out, wherever you aaaaare!
Hmm, I'll have to remember to block off any escape routes before I challenge her next time.
Hmm, maybe the baths?!
N-no! Stop! Stay back!
Oh, THERE you are, Elly!
LEAVE ME ALONE!
It's awfully harsh, don't you think?
I'm just asking for one little fight. Just one!
Hmm? That's Vanessa's voice—and it's coming from my room! Er, but whoever could she be talking to?
Maybe you could put in a good word for me? Help change her mind?
MATILDA!
Wha—?! Oh! Hey, Elly.
What have you done to Matilda?!
What? Nothing! We're just talking. Isn't that right, Matilda?
Get away from her, you!
It's bad enough you've stolen into my room without permission, but I will NOT suffer you to touch her!
This madness ends now, Vanessa. I'll give you the fight you want.
Really?!
Yes. But I hope you're prepared to live with the results.
Of course! Oh, thank you, Elisanne!
You too, Matilda! You're the best!
And, uh...sorry. I know I shouldn't have touched Matilda without permission. That was wrong.
She's just so easy to talk to that I wound up asking her for advice.
Advice? I hesitate to even ask, but...you do know Matilda is a stuffed animal, right?
Uh...yeah? I thought that was pretty obvious. You feeling okay, Elly?
I...I am perfectly fine. I just...wanted to be certain.
Yeesh, Matilda. I'm getting a little worried about your owner here. You hearing this?
I'm not her owner, Vanessa. I'm her friend.
Her friend? You two are friends?
Is there a problem?
I would invite you to choose your reply very carefully.
Aw, don't get me wrong. I think it's great. Just...a little surprising, I guess.
I suppose my impression of you has changed a bit as well.
Come, then. Let us be done with this duel. Oh, and I'm using a practice lance.
I won't have to hold back that way.
Fair enough! I'll lay into you with one of the training axes then!
Hnngh!
Heh heh. It seems I win, Vanessa.
DAMN! Not again! How many times is this, and I haven't beat you once?!
You were the one who desired to know the pain of loss. I am merely the instrument that grants your request.
Well, yeah, but...
The point was for me to get stronger, not just keep losing over and over!
What was it you said? ＂To know defeat is to tread the first step to true strength＂?
Yeah. First time I heard it, it sounded really deep.
Less impressed now?
Duh, of course! I'm not stronger at ALL!
I've lost plenty, and I'm not anywhere CLOSE to catching you.
I don't think that's true at all. With each round, you're growing stronger.
You really think so?!
Of course. I wouldn't lie about something like that.
Whew, good! Then it's just a matter of time before I beat you!
I didn't say that. You're not the only one getting stronger, after all.
That just means it'll be all the sweeter when it happens!
Beating an even stronger version of you will mean I've REALLY grown!
Ever the optimist.
It's a lovely trait.
Y-you think? Gosh...thanks, I guess.
All right, enough talk. I want a rematch!
Again? That was our fifth round today.
So...no?
Well, I don't suppose I can turn down a request from my friend.
F-friend...?
Hm? Why the puzzled look?
N-nothing! Come on, let's fight already!
You seem distracted lately, Vanessa. Something on your mind?
Wh-what? No, I'm just...
Won't you tell me? Please? We're friends.
No. We...we aren't.
I...I see. It seems I was indulging in a one-sided fantasy.
*wince*
There were a few bumps along the way, but I feel we've gotten on well together. Unless I imagined that as well...
Will you at least tell me why it is you think we can't be friends?
It's... I don't want to say. I can't. Not to you.
I see. Then...how about to her?
Huh?
＂Vanessa, if you're unhoppy, I hop you'll tell me why.＂
Low blow, Elly.
Do not look to me! It is Matilda who speaks to you now.
...Heh heh. Right.
Okay, fine. But this is for your ears only, Matilda. Don't go spreading it around.
＂Bunny's honor.＂
I always thought I couldn't be friends with someone weaker than me.
That I'd never be able to look at them as an equal...
＂...Buuut?＂
But it's different with Elly.
I've never beat her once, but she still treats me like a peer. Like a friend!
I feel like that's a sign of what really makes her stronger than me.
Ever since I first saw her, I wanted to be that strong. And now that I know her, I want it more than ever!
＂You ARE strong, Vanessa!＂
I don't—
＂No! You listen to me! The first time you met me, you treated me as a friend.＂
＂Do you think a cute little bunny is stronger than you? No! But that didn't change a thing. You gotta give yourself credit!＂
Elly...
＂It's clear who you are when you're talking to me. That's why I—er, why ELISANNE— knew she wanted to be your friend.＂
Aren't we friends, Vanessa? Can't we be?
...Geez, I'm sorry, Elly.
And thank you. My head feels a lot clearer now.
I want friends, Matilda.
And I want you to be my friend.
＂You're a little late, silly. We've been friends for a while now.＂
Thanks, Matilda.
You too, Elly.
Er, yes. You're very welcome. It's just... This is all a little ticklish. Talk to Matilda.
Oh, Matilda and I are gonna do a lot of talking. If that's all right with my best bun?
＂I'd be hoppy to! We can talk for hours and hours! I love you, Vanessa!＂
I love you too, Elly.
That wasn't me—that was Matilda. I'm already blushing up a storm. Don't make this worse.
